author: jochembrouwer
content:
Hey all, I'm debugging some of our failing hive tests and I think we have some historical code debt regarding the "live Merge transition" regarding hot swapping PoW -> PoS which we are taking out of our code. I can't seem to find the answer on this question: at the Merge, regarding the forkID as of https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-2124.md did we hard-code a `FORK_NEXT` identifier for Merge-ready clients? (Since block/timestamp could not be calculated live back then?). It seems to be? https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3675#eip-2124-fork-identifier
Does someone have a doc/code pointer to this? I checked out Geth releases from back in that time but it does not seem to include a hardcoded `FORK_NEXT`?

author: siladu
content:
It appears EEST doesn't respect https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-2935.md
> the account at HISTORY_STORAGE_ADDRESS will have code and a nonce of 1, and will be exempt from EIP-161 cleanup.
For this test https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/main/tests/prague/eip2935_historical_block_hashes_from_state/test_contract_deployment.py
The alloc for this account has a nonce of 0 and so in Besu the account is cleaned and causes test failures.
